references.reason: This paper introduces the Segment Anything Model (SAM), a powerful and versatile image segmentation model used as a core component of the GaussianProperty framework.
This seminal work highlights the few-shot learning capabilities of large language models (LLMs), laying the groundwork for utilizing LLMs in physical property estimation as done in GaussianProperty.
This document details GPT-4V, the large multimodal model (LMM) that GaussianProperty utilizes for its recognition capabilities in estimating physical properties from images.

references.paper_title: 3D Gaussian Splatting for Real-Time Radiance Field Rendering
references.reason: This paper introduces the 3D Gaussian splatting method, the core 3D representation used in GaussianProperty to represent and manipulate 3D models with associated physical properties.

references.paper_title: ABO: Dataset and Benchmarks for Real-World 3D Object Understanding
references.reason: This paper introduces the ABO dataset, one of the key datasets used to evaluate the performance of GaussianProperty in material segmentation and physical property estimation.
